author: NA
title: Hate speech watchdog CCDH to quit Musk's X ahead of terms change | The Star
text:
FILE PHOTO: 'X' logo is seen reflected on an apartment window across the street from the headquarters of the messaging platform X, formerly known as Twitter, in downtown San Francisco, California, U.S., July 30, 2023. REUTERS/Carlos Barria/File photo
(Reuters) -Social media platform Bluesky is adding millions of users as people flee X after Donald Trump was elected U.S. President and as an upcoming change to the terms of service threatens to complicate legal challenges for the Elon Musk-owned platform.
Bluesky has gained about 2.5 million new users in the past week, raising its total users to more than 16 million, it said on Thursday. It is among a slew of apps looking to replace the platform formerly known as Twitter after Musk's takeover.
"We're seeing record-high activity levels across all different forms of engagement: likes, follows, new accounts, etc, and we're on track to add 1 million new users in one day alone," Bluesky said in a statement.
Several well-known organizations and personalities, including the nonprofit Center for Countering Digital Hate, British news publisher the Guardian and former CNN anchor Don Lemon have said they were leaving X due to concerns about the platform's content and the looming terms change.
X was called out by misinformation experts during the election for playing a central role in enabling the spread of false information about the critical battleground states.
On Nov. 6, as news broke that Musk ally Trump won the presidency, X attracted 46.5 million visits in the U.S. - more than any day in the past year and 38% higher than an average day in recent months, according to analytics firm SimilarWeb.
But more than 115,000 U.S. web visitors deactivated their X accounts – the most since Musk bought the platform, SimilarWeb data showed.
Bluesky's website, meanwhile, attracted around 1.2 million visitors on Nov.6, more than Meta Platforms-owned Threads, which had around 950,000 visitors. But Threads app had more visitors than that of Bluesky.
"Outsized growth, particularly for Bluesky, may have been driven by a rise of controversial content or technical issues on competitor X," said Abraham Yousef, senior insights analyst at market intelligence firm Sensor Tower.
"The departure of popular accounts, media personalities, or organizations, may have led consumers to conclude that X is no longer their preferred platform, which could also be fueling growth on other platforms, particularly Bluesky and Threads."
TERMS CHANGE
The Bluesky surge comes ahead of a change in X's terms on Friday that requires all legal disputes related to the platform to be brought exclusively in the U.S. District Court for the Northern District of Texas or state courts in Tarrant County, Texas.
The Center for Countering Digital Hate said on Thursday the change could hinder legal challenges against the platform by steering future lawsuits toward judges Musk believes "will be on his side".
"Now, the billionaire will be able to bring lawsuits to friendly courts against whoever disagrees with him on his platform," said the nonprofit that has faulted Musk for letting hate speech spread on X.
X and Musk did not respond to requests for comment.
Still, Bluesky's user count is much smaller than rivals. Threads has about 252 million monthly active users on its mobile app, while X has about 317 million, according to Sensor Tower.
"X seems to be in a better position than it has in a while given the ability to represent the views of president-elect Trump," said D.A. Davidson & Co analyst Gil Luria.
"While there are other competing platforms, those may have a hard time catching up with X, since microblogging has significant network effects."
(Reporting by Aditya Soni and Jaspreet Singh in Bengaluru; Additional reporting by Rishi Kant in Bengaluru; Editing by Arun Koyyur)

author: NTN24
title: Inicio de lluvias deja afectaciones en Aragua y Mérida | NTN24.COM
text: [Lluvias en Venezuela](/temas/lluvias-en-venezuela) Inicio de lluvias deja afectaciones en Aragua y Mérida Inundaciones, derrumbes y aumento en el caudal de ríos ya comienzan a registrarse con la llegada de la temporada lluviosa en Venezuela. Los aguaceros de la última semana han causado afectaciones principalmente en los estados Aragua y Mérida, donde las autoridades activaron los protocolos de atención y prevención de emergencias. En el caso de Aragua, los municipio Girardot, Mariño y Linares Alcántara sufrieron anegaciones, afectando al menos cinco viviendas. Varias comunidades argüeñas reportaron fallas eléctricas, en algunos de los casos contaban más de 21 horas sin servicio de electricidad. La gobernadora Karina Carpio, informó que las autoridades se encuentran alerta y están monitoreando de cerca la situación debido a las intensas lluvias que se han presentado en el estado. "Ante cualquier situación comunicarse a través del número 0243-2466554", indicó. En el caso de Mérida, las lluvias han dejado siete viviendas anegadas en diferentes municipios, una unidad educativa y el Ambulatorio Materno Infantil del municipio Campo Elías (Ejido). Se han reportado crecida en los caudales de los principales ríos de la entidad, así como de deslizamiento de material rocoso en varias carreteras, siendo Mérida, Ejido, Lagunillas, Santa Cruz de Mora, Santo Domingo y El Vigía las entidades más afectadas. Continuarán las lluvias Para este viernes 10 de mayo, el Instituto Nacional de Meteorología e Hidrología (Inameh), prevé cielo nublado con precipitaciones de intensidad variable y actividad eléctrica en zonas de la Guayana Esequiba, Bolívar, Amazonas, Apure, sur de Guárico, norte de Mérida y Zulia; mientras que el resto del país se mantendrá con nubosidad fragmentada. En la Región Central y Capital que integran los estados Miranda, La Guaira, Aragua, Carabobo y el Distrito Capital presentan nubosidad fragmentada de tipo estratiforme durante la mañana, con lloviznas dispersas especialmente en zonas de montañas, incrementándose gradualmente la nubosidad después del mediodía, con precipitaciones de intensidad variable con aisladas descargas eléctricas.

author: UK & international sports
title: Arsenal denied a return to Premier League summit as they are beaten by West Ham | Shropshire Star
text: The Gunners went down 2-0 at home Arsenal missed the chance to return to the top of the Premier League as they slipped to a disappointing defeat to West Ham amid more VAR controversy. The Gunners needed victory to replace Liverpool at the summit but lost 2-0 by the Hammers on a night where David Moyes finally landed a victory at the Emirates Stadium. His West Ham side lost Kurt Zouma ahead of the game and Lucas Paqueta after just over half an hour but hit the front through Tomas Soucek’s strike, awarded after VAR could not determine whether the whole ball had gone out of play in the build-up. A second-half header from former Arsenal defender Konstantinos Mavropanos secured the points and things could have been even better for the visitors had Said Benrahma not seen a last-gasp penalty saved by David Raya. Moyes had failed to secure victory in his previous 72 Premier League away games at Arsenal, Chelsea, Liverpool or Manchester United, so this was a long time coming for the Scot. Arsenal laboured when they needed to continue their recent winning run in London derbies to go back to the top of the table. Instead, only captain Martin Odegaard could hold his head high on a night where their defence creaked and Gabriel Jesus was guilty of missing a couple of very good chances. Arsenal started well, with some great touches in and around the West Ham box from Odegaard in particular. But at the other end their defending left a lot to be desired, as Oleksandr Zinchenko and Gabriel Magalhaes failed to deal with a simple ball into the middle. Jarrod Bowen capitalised by latching onto the miscue and teed up Soucek to finish – the goal surviving a lengthy VAR check which could not ultimately make a call on if the ball had not gone out of play before Bowen’s cutback. Arsenal looked to respond although the goal gave West Ham something to defend, although Jesus found a way in behind with a subtle flick into Bukayo Saka, whose header was brilliantly saved by Alphonse Areola. Paqueta had been hurt in the warm-up and lasted just over half an hour, with his fellow Brazilian Gabriel Martinelli curling an effort just wide for Arsenal as they continued in vain to find a leveller. The hosts were getting closer, West Ham gifting possession as two passes saw Arsenal in on goal once more, this time Saka hitting the base of the post from an acute angle. Former West Ham captain Declan Rice fired just over from 25 yards but it was another player coming back to haunt his former club who would find the back of the net soon after. Mavropanos made just seven league starts in three years as an Arsenal player but returned to the Premier League last summer with the Hammers and headed them two goals ahead before the hour. Jesus then headed straight at Areola before sending another fine chance well over the bar moments after Arteta introduced Eddie Nketiah and Reiss Nelson off the bench. Areola was on hand again to keep out a Leandro Trossard effort, with Vladimir Coufal clearing a William Saliba header off the line from the resulting corner. Rice had come off the bench during a 3-0 Carabao Cup defeat on his return to West Ham earlier in the season and endured another night to forget here as he conceded a late penalty for tripping Emerson Palmieri in the box – only for Raya to keep out substitute Benrahma’s tame spot-kick.

author: PTI
title: World News | Mob Attacks Christians in Pakistan over Alleged Desecration; 2 Injured | LatestLY
text: Lahore, May 25 (PTI) A mob led by radical Islamists on Saturday unleashed an attack on Christians in Pakistan Punjab province over the allegations of desecration of the Quran that left at least two members from the minority community injured, one of them seriously, police said. The incident took place in Mujahid Colony Sargodha district of Punjab, some 200 km from Lahore in the morning. Also Read | Purnima Shrestha From Nepal Scripts History, Becomes First Woman To Climb Mt Everest Thrice in Two Weeks. Police claim to have reached the scene on time to control the situation. Several video clips of the mob attack on the properties of the Christian community are doing rounds on social media. Also Read | US Shocker: Man Beheads Tech CEO After Stealing USD 4,00,000 From Him To Hide Theft From Girlfriend. The mob led by radical Tehreek-e-Labbaik Pakistan (TLP) activists attacked the Christian community, burning and ransacking their property. According to senior Punjab police officer Asad Ejaz Malhi, a heavy contingent of police has reached Mujahid Colony and dispersed the mob which had surrounded some houses (of Christians) over the allegations of the desecration of the Quran. He said one injured person has been shifted to a hospital and police have been deployed there to maintain law and order. Another police officer told PTI that on Saturday morning some youth in Mujahid Colony alleged that one Nazir Gill Masih desecrated the Quran. "Following their allegations, a mob led by the TLP activists marched towards the residence and a factory of Nazir. They set ablaze his shoe factory and his house. They also ransacked a few shops owned by Christians. Before police could reach the spot, the mob lynched and thrashed Nazir," he said. However, the police were able to rescue Nazir and shifted him to the hospital where his condition was stated to be critical, the officer said. He said another Christian man also suffered injuries. Ifran Gill, a relative of Nazir, told PTI that his uncle had returned from Dubai after four years. He said some people in the locality accused him falsely of desecration of the Quran. He said the Christian families saved their lives by locking themselves inside their houses when the mob marched towards them. He said the environment has been tense in the area and the Christians are terrified. "Another Jaranwala style attack on Christians in Sargodha with mob attacking the local community, burning and ransacking property. The failure of the State to take any serious and sincere action against perpetrators of the Jaranwala incident has only emboldened those who exploit religious sentiments for their criminal acts," Human rights lawyer and politician Jibran Nasir said on X. The Human Rights Commission of Pakistan (HRCP) said it was seriously concerned by the unfolding situation in Sargodha, where the Christian community in Gillwala village is reportedly at grave risk to their lives at the hands of charged mobs. "There are unconfirmed reports of a man having been allegedly lynched,” the HRCP said on X and asked the Punjab police to immediately restore calm and bring the perpetrators to book, while ensuring that the Christian community comes to no further harm. Sara Taseer, daughter of slain Punjab governor Salman Taseer, said: "The poor Pak Christian community reaches out to me for help when lynchings stir up. Before X was banned, I could alert some groups to help when there was an attack and try to avert the worst. But now they are more cornered than ever." Last year at least 24 churches and over 80 houses belonging to Christians in Jaranwala tehsil of Faisalabad district, some 130 km from the provincial capital, were burnt down by a mob over reports that two Christians had desecrated the Quran. (This is an unedited and auto-generated story from Syndicated News feed, LatestLY Staff may not have modified or edited the content body)

author: IANS
title: Shots fired at house of temple head’s son in Canada - Investing.com India
text:
Toronto, Dec 29 (IANS) Canadian police said it is investigating an incident in which shots were fired at the residence of a Hindu temple's head’s son in British Columbia in the early hours of Wednesday.Police said no one was injured during the incident at the 14900 block of 80 Avenue in Surrey -- the residence of the son of Satish Kumar, president of Lakshmi Narayan Mandir.
"Officers are still working to determine the motive of this incident," said Constable Parmbir Kahlon, Media Relations Officer for Surrey RCMP (Royal Canadian Mounted Police).
Kahlon added that the residence involved sustained damage consistent with bullet holes.
According to the Indo-Canadian voice website, as many as 14 shots were fired at the Hindu businessman's house.
Police remained in the area, examining the scene, speaking with witnesses and canvassing the neighbourhood for CCTV footage.
The Surrey RCMP General Investigation Unit is conducting the probe, and has appealed to anyone with more information, including dash cam footage of the incident, to get in touch with them.
Canada has witnessed a rise in incidents of vandalism and attacks against Hindu temples and installations in the country with pro-Khalistan elements getting active beginning this year.
The situation worsened after Khalistani leader Hardeep Singh Nijjar was shot dead outside a Sikh temple in Surrey on June 18 this year.
The same Lakshmi Narayan Mandir of Surrey was targeted in August this year after anti-India and pro-Khalistan posters were found pasted on its front and rear walls.
Last month, Indian-origin Canadian MP Chandra Arya shared a purported video of pro-Khalistan supporters in Surrey, claiming they want to create trouble at the Lakshmi Narayan Mandir.
In September, Shri Mata Bhameshwari Durga temple in Surrey was defaced with anti-India and pro-Khalistan graffiti on its outer walls.
Incidents of vandalism have also occurred at temples in Brampton and the Greater Toronto area.
--IANS
mi/dan
Add Chart to Comment

author: Salman Khan
title: Silvano Fashion Group Sees Profit Growth in 2023: Annual Financial Highlights Revealed
text:
Amidst a fluctuating global economy, Silvano Fashion Group has reported a notable improvement in financial performance for the year 2023, signaling resilience and strategic expansion in the retail sector. This analysis delves into the key financial indicators, investment activities, and personnel changes that marked the company's journey through the year, juxtaposed against the broader context of tech-driven efficiency gains in the industry.
Financial Milestones Achieved
2023 proved to be a year of growth for Silvano Fashion Group, with sales reaching 58,597 thousand EUR, a modest but significant increase of 1.6% over the previous year. A more pronounced growth was observed in the company's gross profit, which soared by 9.3% to 33,743 thousand EUR, underpinned by a gross margin improvement of 7.5% and a reduction in the cost of sold goods by 7.2%. This financial upswing was further accentuated by a 22.6% increase in consolidated operating profit, amounting to 17,973 thousand EUR, and a 15.5% hike in consolidated EBITDA, totaling 21,120 thousand EUR. Despite these gains, the reported consolidated net profit attributable to equity holders dipped to 9,927 thousand EUR, from a higher margin in the preceding year.
Strategic Investments and Structural Adjustments
In alignment with its growth trajectory, the Group channeled 1,133 thousand EUR into property, plant, and equipment, marking a significant uptick from the previous year's investment. This capital injection primarily facilitated the opening and refurbishment of retail outlets, alongside enhancements in production efficiency. Personnel dynamics within the Group also witnessed subtle shifts, with a slight increase in the workforce to 1,626 employees, reflecting the company's commitment to bolstering its retail and production capabilities. Concurrently, the Group's financial solidity was underscored by a 12.9% increase in consolidated assets, reaching 72,252 thousand EUR as of December 31, 2023.
Corporate Governance and Future Outlook
The year also saw pivotal decisions made by the Group's governing bodies, including the proposal to adopt resolutions of the annual general meeting of shareholders without convening a physical meeting, a testament to the evolving corporate governance practices in the digital age. Looking ahead, Silvano Fashion Group's strategic investments and operational optimizations, especially in the realm of AI and tech integration, as hinted by broader industry trends
(source), position it favorably for sustained growth amidst evolving market dynamics.
The financial resilience and strategic adaptability demonstrated by Silvano Fashion Group in 2023 not only reflect its robust response to global economic challenges but also spotlight the potential for leveraging technology to enhance operational efficiencies. As the retail sector continues to navigate the complexities of digital transformation, the Group's performance offers valuable insights into the synergies between traditional retail strategies and cutting-edge technological advancements. With a clear focus on sustainable growth and market responsiveness, Silvano Fashion Group is poised to continue its trajectory of innovation and financial strength in the years to come.

author: AFP
title: Thousands protest Pakistan Supreme Court minorities ruling | National
text:
Thousands of Pakistanis protested against the Supreme Court's top judge on Friday, after he issued a ruling related to blasphemy that sparked online backlash and thinly veiled death threats.
A campaign targeting Supreme Court Chief Justice Qazi Faez Isa began after he ordered the release of a man from the Ahmadi religious sect, considered heretical by hardline Muslim scholars.

author: Get News
title: Discover The Secret To Peace And Spirituality With These Five Transformative Books | User | bigspringherald.com
text:
Dr. Aldric Marshall, a resilient Air Force veteran, esteemed Pastor, and renowned author, emerges as a beacon of wisdom and inspiration with his transformative collection of six books that delve deep into the realms of spirituality, decision-making, and the unseen forces shaping our destinies.
Seven Trading Floors of Heaven : Confronting and Overcoming Ungodly Exchanges:
Embarking on a journey of spiritual transactions and divine economy, Dr. Marshall challenges readers to perceive their daily decisions as spiritual trades. This thought-provoking narrative draws parallels between earthly and spiritual exchanges, urging individuals to align their choices with divine principles. The book unfolds as a guide to making decisions that foster spiritual growth and harmonize with God's will, offering invaluable insights into the unseen realms that influence our paths.
Grace Beyond Measure : A Journey to the Heart of God’s Gift:
In a touching exploration of divine grace, Dr. Marshall weaves together theological insights and personal narratives to illuminate the transformative power of God's unmerited gift. From daily manifestations of grace to forgiveness in the face of adversity, the book traverses mystical dimensions, emphasizing its universal nature. "Grace Beyond Measure" becomes a roadmap for navigating life with humility, compassion, and a deepened connection with the divine.
Whispers At the Crossroads : The Silent Power Of the Pivot:
Focusing on life's pivotal moments, Dr. Marshall navigates the critical junctures of decision-making, termed as crossroads. Encouraging introspection, courage, and a readiness for change, the book advocates for personal growth through these decisive moments. With profound insights, it becomes a guiding light for those seeking to evolve and shape their destinies at the crossroads of life.
Triumph Over Darkness : The Victorious Journey of Faith:
Delving into the spiritual battlefield, this book unfolds as an exploration of spiritual warfare from a Christian perspective. Dr. Marshall unravels the origins of evil, revealing the believer's authority in Christ. Through insights into spiritual strategies and the triumph of Jesus Christ, the book empowers believers to stand firm in faith, offering a roadmap to victory over the forces of darkness.
Hell Is Real : Understanding the Landscape Of the Infernal Realm:
In a daring exploration of theological concepts and personal experiences, Dr. Marshall takes readers on a journey through the infernal realm. Covering aspects of Hell, sin, punishment, and divine justice, the book provides a comprehensive view of its impact on faith and morality. It challenges beliefs and invites readers to contemplate the complex nature of the afterlife.
The books can be purchased on Amazon: https://www.amazon.com/stores/Dr.-Aldric-Marshall/author/B0CLT234PW .
About Dr. Aldric Marshall:
Dr. Aldric Marshall, a resilient Air Force veteran turned impactful Pastor at Connecting the World With the Word Ministries (CTW), demonstrates unwavering commitment despite personal challenges. With a Ph.D. in philosophy and counseling and two master's degrees in theology and National Security Affairs, Dr. Marshall's dedication is evident in his role on the Domestic Violence homicide review board in Palm Beach County and participation in the FBI Citizen Academy, showcasing a commitment to safety, security, and personal empowerment.
